title: Handwriting Font
content:
Hi All,

I’m trying to find a good handwriting font that I can use for my magazine project. It needs to be neat but casual. I am considering generating my own handwriting font, but then my handwriting isn’t “American” enough.

Is there any font that you would recommend?

Please let me know!

Thanks so much,  
tsongtze
author: tsongtze

comments.content:
Hmm… I think more towards the print writing direction, but not totally… It’s hard to describe what I really want.  
I think the closest so far is the Rats font… Any more suggestions?

So far I like Rats, Shimmer, and Handsome Pro. I’ll try these out!

Thanks!

You want something natural that is also readable, right?

[Feltpen](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.102883.0.0)  
 [Fineprint](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.100805.0.0)  
 [ITC Django](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=ITC.106136.0.0)  
 [FF Hands](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.735.0.0)  
 [ITC Berranger Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=ITC.106132.0.0)  
 [Notec](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.116773.0.0)  
Mark Simonson’s [Felt Tip series](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=felt%20tip)  
 [Venture](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.117489.0.0)  
 [Ego](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402200022/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.116749.0.0) (like many of these, should only be used small)
Try Cezanne Pro it gives you a lot of glyphs for variety
